parts.text: (a) any six of the parts (a) to (j). (i) Name two species that might be included in a seed mixture in a short‐term ley for silage. (ii) Give a reason for each choice.
Water is held in the soil in two main ways.

subparts.text: Name both ways and explain how each works.
Give two benefits of artificial drainage in soils.

parts.text: (i) Give three ways in which soil acidity increases over time. (ii) Explain the mechanism at work in each case. (iii) Describe two effects of increased soil acidity on crops.

subparts.text: Give three ways in which soil acidity increases over time.
Explain the mechanism at work in each case.
Describe two effects of increased soil acidity on crops.

parts.text: Describe an experiment to show cation exchange in a soil sample.

parts.text: (i) Describe the physiological changes that occur during the ripening process in the cereal referred to above. (ii) Describe two tests carried out by a grain merchant on harvested grain.

parts.text: To compare the digestibility of whole and rolled cereal grains.

(i) List two qualitative tests and two quantitative tests normally carried out on milk. (ii) Describe how you would carry out in the laboratory any one of the quantitative tests referred to above.

parts.text: (i) Name two lowland sheep breeds and describe their bodily characteristics. (ii) Explain fully why crossbred ewes are frequently used in a lowland sheep enterprise.

subparts.text: Name two lowland sheep breeds and describe their bodily characteristics.

parts.text: (i) Explain the term reproductive efficiency. (ii) Describe three factors affecting reproductive efficiency.

subparts.text: Explain the term reproductive efficiency.

parts.text: Describe how the dry matter digestibility (DMD) of a grass plant alters during its various stages of growth.
Describe four measures that can be used to maintain a high grass DMD for longer during the grazing season.
Explain how the ruminant stomach is suited to the digestion of plants in a grassland sward.

Many Irish suckler beef producers are currently taking part in the Beef Data and Genomics Programme which aims to improve profitability in the suckler sector. Elements of this programme include performance testing and progeny testing.

subparts.text: Explain the terms performance testing and progeny testing.
List three characteristics which are important in the selection of replacement heifers for a suckler enterprise.

parts.text: Explain the following concepts in genetics and give an appropriate example in each case. (i) Incomplete dominance (ii) Alleles (iii) Continuous variation.

subparts.text: Incomplete dominance:
Alleles:
Continuous variation:

parts.text: In mice the allele for wild type coat colour (W) is dominant to the allele for albino coat (w). The allele for straight hair (S) is dominant to the allele for bent hair (s). Two mice, heterozygous for both these genes, were mated. Taking care to differentiate clearly between uppercase and lowercase letters, explain with the aid of a Punnett square, the probability in each case that the offspring would have the following phenotypes. (i) Albino coat (ii) Bent hair (iii) Albino coat and bent hair (iv) Wild type coat colour and bent hair.

subparts.text: Albino coat:
Bent hair:
Albino coat and bent hair:
Wild type coat colour and bent hair:
